channel.title: How to remove built in specials (Project 16 V6)
channel.description: Does anyone know how to properly remove the specials that are built-in, in project 16 V6? Because I have found a better version of the specials and I want to add that one instead, and yes, I have tried just replacing the old specials, but it doesn't work.... Please post...

item.title: How to remove built in specials (Project 16 V6)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

those are probally the best your gonna get at the moment due to selfish people not posting better
but those are pretty easy to add and if you have a problem they provided you with a client and ghandler to look through to see how to add it

Read full topic

all i get is a commented out case and method

DragonLongSpecial()
 /* case 29030: DragonLongSpecial(); break; */

is comented out so it really isnt there but you can delete them if you want

besides that the rest i told you how to get rid of…

item.source: How to remove built in specials (Project 16 V6)

item.title: How to remove built in specials (Project 16 V6)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

hey burnnsilience its different,this source is befrore they had special bars so there were only a case and few ints and a down timer to remove

find these

public int specBar = 100;
public int specialRestoreTimer;

and delete them then find public boolean process and find this

	specialRestoreTimer++;

	if (specialRestoreTimer == 120)
	{
		specialRestoreTimer = 0;
		specBar += 25;
	}
	if (specBar >= 100)
	{
	sendQuest("@gre@&&&&&&&&&&", 174);
	}
	if (specBar == 75)
	{
	sendQuest("@gre@&&&&&&&@red@&&&", 174);
	}
	if (specBar == 50)
	{
	sendQuest("@gre@&&&&&@red@&&&&&", 174);
	}
	if (specBar == 25)
	{
	sendQuest("@gre@&&&@red@&&&&&&&", 174);
	}
	if (specBar == 0)
	{
	sendQuest("@red@&&&&&&&&&&", 174);
	}

delete that also

then find…and replace

case 168:

with…

case 168://yes emote
startAnimation(855);
		break;

hope this helps

Read full topic

delete the WHOLE voids, it doesnt matter if you have your own specs to replace them

fury just search for stuff with “5698” and remove it if it has anythign to do with “gfx”
note 5698 is just a dds, look for spec voids too :\
